For those who love a challenge, the climb to the top of the mountain is a must. It's about 400 steps to the summit, and while the hike can be steep and demanding, the panoramic view from the top is absolutely worth the effort. The sight of Ha Long Bay from above, with its emerald waters and scattered islands, is truly awe-inspiring and makes the climb more than rewarding.

If you prefer a more relaxed experience, the island's beach is a great place to unwind. The white sand is soft and clean, continuously washed by the tide, and the water is clear and inviting for a swim. Whether you choose to lounge on a deckchair or take a dip in the sea, the beach offers a peaceful escape from the bustling tourist spots.

The island also holds historical significance, named after a Russian general who helped Vietnam during the war, adding a unique cultural layer to the visit.

Overall, Titop Island is a must-visit destination in Ha Long Bay. Whether you're climbing to the top for a breathtaking view or relaxing on the pristine beach, this island offers an unforgettable experience. Highly recommended for anyone exploring the bay!

reviews.text:
B√°i Th∆° Mountain (N√∫i B√†i Th∆°) is one of the most famous tourist destinations in Ha Long, Quang Ninh, offering both stunning natural beauty and historical significance. Located in the heart of Ha Long City, the mountain stands as an iconic landmark, attracting visitors with its breathtaking views and cultural heritage.

The mountain, with an elevation of 200 meters, is not particularly high, but it provides a magnificent panoramic view of Ha Long Bay, which is known for its emerald waters and thousands of limestone islands. From the summit, visitors can enjoy a 360-degree view of the bay, the bustling city, and nearby islands, making it an ideal spot for photography and sightseeing. The view from B√°i Th∆° Mountain is especially mesmerizing at sunset, when the sky is painted with shades of orange and pink, creating a peaceful and scenic atmosphere.

In addition to its natural beauty, B√°i Th∆° Mountain is also historically significant. At the top of the mountain, there is an ancient stone inscription with the words ‚ÄúB√°i Th∆°,‚Äù which means ‚Äúpoetry offering,‚Äù created by King Le Thanh Tong in 1468. The inscription honors the natural beauty of Ha Long Bay and the poetic spirit of the region. It is said that the king visited the mountain to enjoy the view and compose poetry, which further adds to the cultural appeal of the site.

For those visiting Ha Long, climbing B√°i Th∆° Mountain is a must-do activity. The hike is relatively easy and takes around 20-30 minutes, making it accessible to most visitors. The trail is lined with trees and steps that lead to the top, where the magnificent view awaits. Whether you're a nature lover, a photography enthusiast, or a history buff, B√°i Th∆° Mountain offers an unforgettable experience.

I seldom leave review but I think it is necessary to provide some useful guidance for those hiking enthusiasts.

A big thanks to Theresa Lou (the last review before me) who had clearly pointed out that the entrance to the mountain is 106 Hang Noi, which is totally different from the information that can be found on the website (which mentions the blue door beside a photocopy shop).

In fact, I have passed by the blue door when taking a grab. If you are taking a grab, you can put the address as 86 Hang Noi. Do note that 106 Hang Noi is not directly facing the main street. So after you alight, look for a lady and say the word ‚Äòmountain'. She will respond to you if she is the right person and she will ask you to walk through the alley and she will meet you at the behind of her house.

You will enter her house and climb the stairs to the third floor which leads to the outside gate. The lady will continue to guide you and you will see a long ladder which you will need to move it together with her and put it against the rock wall. She then asked for money, and I directly gave VND100K and she accepted it.

The most challenging part is to climb the ladder and hike towards the left direction until you see a proper walk path with wooden fence. Then just continue the path until to the top of the mountain. I spent around 20 minutes from climbing the ladder to the summit, which was considerably fast.

Rest assured that the view is totally rewarding and you will be amazed by the scenery!

I went there by grab and the address I used was Hang Noi 86. This viewpoint has different entrances, it can be at house number 86 or house 106 from what I know. I used the house number 86. Most of the trail has a good path made of concrete but no maintenance, I think they made that to reach the internet antenna up on the viewpoint. After entering house number 86 I paid 100.000 and started my walk. The beginning is hard as you can see in the first video. You have to use the ladder and then climb the mountain slightly. This part is dangerous, but after that, it's okay. I recommend you do the trail early in the mourning because there is no shade at all and it was so hot up there

I'll start by saying we already miss Quang and the crew! Taking a one night cruise with L'Azalee is one of the best experiences of my life. From a private car pickup to the waiting area at the marina to boarding the boat we were welcomed and appreciated. Everyone was friendly and they were ready for us.  As always, I love a welcome drink (refreshing cold green tea) and a cool towel upon arrival.  The food was outstanding, especially their salad. We had different seafood and meats, lots of fruit and spring rolls. I loved their oysters! They offer a large selection of ice cold beer and delicious mixed drinks. EXCURSIONS ARE AMAZING!!! During our 24 hours we went to a huge cave that was astounding, mountain climbing to the top of an island with breathtaking views, swimming at the beach, learned how to make spring rolls, toured  a Pearl Farm, Kayaked and attempted squid fishing with bamboo polls. We even started the morning with a personal Ti Chi class after a picture perfect sunrise. Through out the adventures Quang shared stories with us, told us history and pointed out unique sights along the way.  We enjoyed talking to him and he was great at answering our questions.  It was sad to leave him as he was so much fun to be around.  This trip is worth every penny.  There is a lot of development in the area so be sure to go ASAP!!! Pro Tip: bring water with you, you can buy small bottles on the boat for about $1.50 US.

reviews.text: One of the highlights of our holiday in Vietnam was our 3 day 2 night cruise in Halong Bay. With a whole range of options to choose from we selected Paradise as they came well recommended. Additionally we chose the smaller vessel (Peak) anticipating a more personalised and private experience and we were not disappointed! The registration point is about 45 minutes from Haiphong airport. Grabs easily available. Avoid the taxi guys who try and cancel your grab booking at the ‚Äòsame price'! From the welcome staff, butlers, safety briefing to our final goodbye on day 3, we were superbly taken care off by the service crew. Shout out to Genesis, Crystal, the Chef and always smiling Captain! The suites were well appointed and large. The spa/jacuzzi was great too. Food was superb and always overflowing. We were stuffed to the gills. For some reason the chefs assumed that we had dietary restrictions (vegetarian) and when we made it very clear that we had none, they worked well to ensure that we had a full menu. A nice choice of wines (sparkling and regular) as well as spirits and cocktails kept us buzzing till late in the evening! The excursions were nice - a bit touristy but as this was a small vessel we were ahead of the crowds many times so had peace and tranquility for a bit before things got congested. Ha Long Bay was a unique and unforgettable experience.

What an absolute waste of money. At ¬£600 per night and labelled as 5*Star luxury with a butler service, I was expecting just that. Oh no, no, noooo‚Ä¶. The butler service? If this constitutes 3 young girls, who 90% of the time were on their phones chatting or nowhere to be seen or heard, then wonderful, but it's not what I'd expect. Yes, they were lovely people, but no, they not did provide any service or care. Utter marketing rubbish.

The boat itself was so tired and battered. I slept for 2 hours as I spent the entire night trying to wedge the windows with toilet paper as they rattled so much. The bathrooms had more mould in them than a vintage cheese. The jacuzzi in the bathroom didn't work and when it nearly did, I'm surprised I wasn't electrocuted!

Bar staff and drinks?‚Ä¶ nope. Yes, drinks were offered after dinner, but when sitting outside for post drinks, we were sat in darkness with no bartender to be seen and this was at 21:00!

We struggled to find and then make up our own sun loungers and seating on the sun deck. Oh woah is you, I hear you say. But when paying ¬£600 per night, yes ¬£600 per a night, I'd expect something so simple to be prepared!

‚ÄòYou will spend the night in a secluded bay relaxing and enjoying the fresh night air'. No, we did not. We were sat in a bay with around 30 other huge boats, with all their sound systems screaming and dazzling lights glaring away. Congested and polluted. It was actually very sad. The air was thick with fumes, so much so, I resorted to my inhaler to breath! Again, whilst trying to sleep, I couldn't, as lights the brightness of Time Square shone into my room!
It's a shame. As this area is so unbelievably beautiful (in pictures) but in real life it's the perfect example of cash cow tourist.
The only saving grace for me, was a seaplane ride the following day. This was soooo much fun and allowed me to actually see for myself the beauties Ha Long Bay has to offer.
I will add‚Ä¶ the reasons for 2 stars. 1 star for the staff and if useless, were at least very kind and friendly. The 2nd star for the fresh bed linen!

This is an exceptional cruise experience from start to finish. The transfers are extremely comfortable and seamless. Paradise Peak boat is stylish, elegant while displaying real style and culture. The room was exceptional with big views out to the bay, even in the bathroom. The food was also magnificent, with huge amounts of seafood, Vietnamese and western food on offer. The variety and choice available was fabulous, as was the choice of drinks available.
The crew were courteous, kind and could not do enough for us, from explaining the details of the bay and the boats to taking photos and looking after us on excursions.
It is truly a trip of a lifetime and an experience we will never forget. Thank you so much.
